p: The Hepatitis C virus (HCV) was formally described in 1989 ( Choo et al., 1989) and, currently, HCV infection is one of the most important infectious diseases in terms of global public health burden. HCV is an enveloped single-stranded positive-sense RNA virus, has seven genotypes, and belongs to the Flaviviridae family, Hepacivirus genus ( Pietschmann and Brown, 2019). It is estimated that 71 million individuals are chronically infected by HCV worldwide ( Vigan√≤ et al., 2019).
